1-8 word Summary: A mute person sharing their glow up
Keywords (comma separated): mute, trending, hashtag, music, audio, ASL
Comments: A mute person sharing their version of a very popular trend on TikTok where people share pictures of their glow up. Those videos are usually linked to specific music but this creator has a video with no music and some environmental noises that are barely noticeable. This shows no audio editing and most importantly no linking his video to the musics that would also work as tag and could expand his visibility. The use of hashtags in the video description is very limited and not similar to most videos doing the same trend which is unclear if it is for lack of understanding or choice. They used written words in the video like it is commonly done for this trend and did not use ASL.

TikTok showed me how important it is to have ethical design has part of product design. Some disabled people just want to participate in popular things like everyone else and as a future computer scientist I hope to bring this topic to whatever product I end up working with.

1-8 word Summary: Mute creator playing with TikTok trends
Keywords (comma separated): mute, Tiktok, trending, music, hashtag, ASL, audio
Comments: The creator makes a TikTok that plays with written words in the scree, font color, and light. I believe he uses ASL but not necessarily sure if he is saying the same sentence that is floating on the screen. The audio had no editing, which means he did not use the usual music associated with this trend. This also means that his video is not linked to the rest of the trend by the music and his reach is compromised. Also, they use only one hashtags and it does not match other's use of hashtag for this trend.

Keywords (comma separated): trend, mute, deaf, TikTok, product design
Comments: This video got my attention for being a trend that relies on music for the performance and has a tag and how not utilizing the music did not link this personâ€™s content to the rest of the trend. Offering ways to tag a video to a trend without having the music playing in the background could be something to be explored by TikTok.

1-8 word Summary: Rikki Has Carpal Tunnel And Can't Sign (ASL)
Keywords (comma separated): Deaf, Carpal Tunnel, American Sign Language, Anxiety
Comments: Immediately, right off the bat, this terrifies me. Like, I struggle with carpal tunnel from how horrible my work posture is and that already makes me terrified, but to imagine that also impeding my primary forms of communication? I would just. Be so anxious.
I think about a similar thing. It terrifies me. All of my work relies on my hands, so what am I to do if I can't use my hands?

1-8 word Summary: Losing the ability to learn to sign
Comments: I'm new to this person's channel, so I'm not sure what their experience with learning ASL has been, but I would have a pretty similar reaction if I just got carpal tunnel and it impeded my ability to learn more. It would be really easy for me to just throw my hands up in the air and despair.

1-8 word Summary: The Little Doubt In The Back of Your Mind
Comments: I feel like I can relate to the anxiety she's experiencing. At least on some level, I know how disheartening it is to have such a unique issue that it's hard to get advice or support on it. It means a lot when you can finally find someone else who understands what you're going through. I do appreciate her acknowledgement of positivity and that there are actions she can take, but I'm familiar with that despair.

1-8 word Summary: Dissonance Between the Audio and the Video
Comments: Just something else I noticed-- she seems really animated in the video but her voice is very limited, so I rely on closed captioning to watch her. Kinda highlights her struggles as a deaf person, and kinda forces her audience to understand what it means to be in her world.
